Agency: Transportation Department Aviation Consumer Protection Division

Description: U.K.-based British Airways PLC and South Korean-based Korean Air Lines Co. Ltd. each agreed to plead guilty and pay separate $300 million criminal fines for their roles in conspiracies to fix the prices of passenger and cargo flights.

Description: British Airways and Iberia Airlines agreed to pay $5.8 million to resolve their liability under the False Claims Act for falsely reporting the times they transferred possession of United States mail to foreign postal administrations or other intended recipients under contracts with the United States Postal Service.
